page.title: 02Town Twinning
page.content: Since 1972 there has been a steady development of twinning activities between Honiton and Mezidon-Canon in France. In June 1973 the charter was signed pledging cultural, sporting and touristic links between the two towns. Many families have made exchange visits. The Community College and Honiton Primary School send pupils regularly to France. Since 1979 Honiton children have exchanged with Gronau (Leine) in West Germany which is Mezidon's twin town. When they visit they meet pupils from there and also from Fijnaart in the Netherlands. Twinning activities are promoted by a committee set up by Honiton Town Council. This year the Mayor has visited Gronau and invited his German counterpart to return in the hope that it will lead to more formal links.
